name: On Our Own
description: Mittelafrika has collapsed, likely forever. From the ashes many nations have arisen, including Dahomey. We are a new nation, weak and fragile. Thus we have decided to align with our old colonial masters in Algeria for protection.\nTogether we shall build a brighter future!

name: Expand the Topke System.
description: Most of our population lives in the countryside, and thus we must use special patrols to collect taxes: the Topke system. Expanding these patrols will generate more revenue for our young state.

name: Expanding our hold over the plantations
description: The plantations in our country provide quite a bit of revenue. Let us bring them under our control, so that the government can more directly benefit from their wealth.

name: French Industrial Help
description: We lack a real industry to call our own, and we will need a lot of help in building and modernizing our factories. We should invite the French to help upgrade our factories with better equipment and train our engineers and workers.

name: Expanding the Toll Systems
description: Part of our income came from various tolls.\nIf we fix up the various roads left behind by the old German administration, we can then place more tolls on them and generate revenue even on the most remote roads.

name: Exploiting Our Natural Resources
description: Nature holds many treasures, especially deep below ground. Our mines can and should be improved in order to better exploit the riches that can be found within.

name: Utilize French Expertise
description: The French, even when exiled to Africa, have more knowledge in the fields of science, production and warfare than we could ever gain on our own.\nBy drawing even closer to France we can utilize their expertise and become one of the most advanced nations in Africa.

name: Further Resource Exploitation
description: Dahomey's mines have provided much wealth, but we can dig deeper, and find even more.\nIn a similar vein, our plantations can be better funded, better directed, and better equipped to provide a grander harvest.

name: Dahomey Stands Proud
description: As we continue to develop our economy and build up our national might, we will be better able to defend our freedom and soverignty from any and all who might seek to destroy us.

name: Ask The French For Assistance
description: We are a small nation, and so we must husband our resources carefully. Perhaps we could ask the French for some industrial or military assistance in this matter.

name: Tax Incentives
description: French investment in the economy can only benefit Dahomey, and them in return. French companies would be incentivized to come and invest if we were to give them some tax breaks.

name: Our Navy
description: Dahomey's ports fell into disrepair under the Germans in favour of more lucrative ventures.\nWe should take the time to repair and redevelop the ports, and from there build a proper navy.

name: The Royal Flagship
description: We lack the resources to make a large quantity of ships, therefore we must focus on quality above all. Let us research and plan a flagship fit for Dahomey, a flagship that will show the world that we are not to be threatened.

name: Support Fleet
description: With the flagship in place, we must now develop ships that can support and protect it.

name: Dahomey Takes To The Sea
description: Our naval officers are inexperienced to the point that many are landlubbers pretending to be men of the sea. We must get them better trained and have them spend more time out on the waves.

name: The State Of Our Army
description: Dahomey's freedom is only secure so long as we have the men and the guns to defend it.\nLet us call up volunteers, and if need be a draft, in order to build a new army to defend our people.

name: Training and Preparation
description: Saying that the army is inexperienced is an understatement.\nWe shall host a variety of war games and training exercises to bring our army up to modern standards.

name: King and General
description: Historically the leaders of Dahomey have stood alongside our generals. Though perhaps out of place in modern times, we shall make sure that our men know that the King marches with them at least in spirit.

name: Import Foreign Arms
description: Dahomey has a history of importing firearms due to our inability to manufacture our own.\nThough we now have that capability, we can still benefit from shopping around to supplement what we can produce.

name: Reinstating Agaja's Dowry
description: Men who are not motivated by national pride to join the army can instead be motivated by pay. King Agaja understood this, and once instated a dowry for soldiers who joined his army. We can revive the concept, and reinstate the dowry to bring more recruits to their posts.

name: Dahomey's Amazons
description: Before the French and the Germans came, there were the Ahosi. This elite group of women warriors were well regarded for their ferocity and combat prowess. We can revive the Ahosi, and give our soldiers a reason to fight harder.

name: German Salvage
description: The Germans beat a hasty retreat into Nigeria, leaving behind quite the stockpile of equipment and other assorted valuables. We should gather them up and sell what we can for some immediate revenue.

name: Strip Their Banners!
description: There are those still loyal to the Germans who once oppressed us. Let us show those loyalists that we are in charge now, and strip everything that they could use as a symbol to rally around.

name: Empty Their Barracks!
description: The barracks that once hosted German soldiers lie empty, and are ripe for the taking. Let us seize what we can, and use the rifles and ammunition left behind to form a stockpile for our army.

name: Expel their loyalists!
description: Those who remain loyal to the Germans are becoming an annoyance. The King has the power and authority to expel them from Dahomey, and if they want to go live with the Germans so badly, we can show them the door.

name: Appeal to the French
description: Before the Weltkrieg, Dahomey was a part of the larger French empire in Africa.\nWe are once again part of that empire, but not all remember it fondly. We must find new ways to appeal to the French while also keeping out citizens happy.

name: Deepen Protectorate Ties
description: The world is a big place, with powers far greater than us trying to toy with our land. Seeking closer ties with our overlord might safe guard our nation more effectively than we could alone.

name: The Status Quo
description: DAH_status_quo

name: A Balanced Posture
description: While the French aren't... evil... overlords... There is nothing wrong with reducing their influence, and moving towards being a truly free nation.

name: Establishing The University of Porto Novo
description: We shall establish the University of Porto Novo to bring higher learning to Dahomey and accelerate our research and development.
